title: When I see a downvoted thread in M&G that involves 0 hate or mocking people

replies.body:
It's not even just M&G. There's something about this whole new community that's so off. I don't know what it is, but they don't understand true comedy.

Sample evidence:

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/cyuNM3wq-gangplanks-old-chest-hair-was-one-thing-but
Observant and witty, yet loathed. 
Why? 
Who knows. Regardless of it being in the wrong section, **why is the community so sour about it?**

Yet something that makes 0 sense will receive tons of praise:
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/7gbIVAAT-when-your-ally-begs-you-not-to-killsteal-the-3-hp-enemy-champion

You can also post a champion's portrait to get likes as well. Nothing but the portrait. We're not allowed to make this new community think too much, apparently (this is also why Malzahar, of all champions, is being Olaf'd.). Even though the thread attempted to tell a joke, "Moon-do" isn't even funny, and it's a bit of a stretch even for a pun.
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/Bmv20Qbd-who-is-dianas-number-1-supporter 

It can't be because I'm surely older than 90% of the people who live on this forum. If something isn't clever or doesn't make sense, it isn't funny. I want to say this generation has rotted their brains out from Spongebob and staring at their phones all day, but that seems too extreme to be true.

> I don't know what it is, but they don't understand true comedy.

Comedy is very subjective thing and just because people don't share your preferences doesn't mean you have to be sour and go about spam posting it everywhere.

> It can't be because I'm surely older than 90% of the people who live on this forum. If something isn't clever or doesn't make sense, it isn't funny. I want to say this generation has rotted their brains out from Spongebob and staring at their phones all day, but that seems too extreme to be true.

The fact that you insulted an entire generation simply based on your opinion about what the community of actually **several generations** finds funny then you sir are a completely self centered moron. If you are older than 90% of the community then grow the fuck up and understand that people have different preferences and stop bitching about it.

I'm just expressing my opinion.
A very uh, harsh opinion. A harsh opinion, slightly on par with what this man just said. What you mocked him for.

> [{quoted}](name=King Odarth,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=EPgu0Lz8,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2016-07-19T06:03:56.186+0000)
>
> Comedy is very subjective thing and just because people don't share your preferences doesn't mean you have to be sour and go about spam posting it everywhere.
> 
> The fact that you insulted an entire generation simply based on your opinion about what the community of actually **several generations** finds funny then you sir are a completely self centered moron. If you are older than 90% of the community then grow the fuck up and understand that people have different preferences and stop bitching about it.
> 
> I'm just expressing my opinion.

It's not about sharing my preferences. It's elaborating on what comedy is. You can't walk into a night club, shout "car" and think you told a joke. That's not humor on any level. **There is no sense to it.** No punchline.
Sure, young children might get a giggle out of it because it's something wacky and spontaneous like what you'd see in a 2000's Nickelodeon cartoon, but it's not true comedy. Like penis jokes, it's lazy and a genuine insult to the craft.
While many forms of comedy exist, of course everyone won't like them all. Liked or hated, they are still acknowledged as forms of comedy. However, if it's not comedy whatsoever, it can't be subjective.

That is what the newest generation doesn't understand.

Blatant observations clue into what the next generation has become. It's really not a mystery. I wouldn't be surprised if Spongebob's laugh was echoing in your head as you typed your comment to me on your iPhone.

All that said, I'll certainly do my best to grow up with the mouth of a sailor and resorting to name-calling, just like you, ma'am.

I like how you decided to stalk my comment history to find my post here with intent to personally harass me, though. That's not psychotic at all.

Listen, I hate this board and basically only come hear to punish myself, but you're being just as annoying. Comedy is subjective, and while you (and I) might think this type of """"humor"""" is lazy, whining about it won't change anything. Instead, find a different community that has a more refined taste.

And to be honest, your Jhin post did make me giggle a bit, so take that.

You're right, but it's always been that way. Memes and Games was the one safe place where posts could have dozens of upvotes and not a single one would have a downvote unless there was a reason. Recently though, like within the last week, that's changed :l

The first thread I... don't find it all that witty or funny at all honestly. Like I get the joke, even if it did take me a moment to fully grasp what was being said but I don't find it funny, or amusing. It doesn't make me giggle, I don't know I just don't find it funny. 

As for the second thread, it does make sense? Like I get what they are trying to say and I even find it kind of amusing. Mostly because I've been in the situation before. I mean it's not like heart stopping hilarious but it's cute, it's amusing. It's pokemon which is something I grew up with so it already warms me up to the thread. Even if it's Arceus which is a pokemon I'm not super familiar with. (Original 150 for the win.)

The third thread I didn't get at all until it was explained. Once I understood I found it kinda cute but not hilarious. It could honestly be because I play Diana and adore her as a character and her terrible jokes. So I just have a bit of an affinity for it in general. 

To be clear I wouldn't downvote any of the threads but I'd likely only upvote the middle thread. Humor is subjective, and it really just depends on what sort of audience you are catering to. These are just my thoughts on the threads, there are hundreds of people in these boards so you can imagine that's hundreds of different opinions and thoughts. 

Regardless of how old you are or how young what you find funny is going to vary from person to person not necessarily age to age. There are a number of things my generation finds hilarious that I don't find all that funny. To be perfectly clear, what you find clever, or what makes sense to you, might not be clever or make sense to someone else. I've never watched Spongebob, I don't find it funny either. It's a little rude to condemn a whole generation because a group of people whom you don't know the age of didn't find your joke funny. Humor is relative, what's funny is relative, what's fun is relative, you can't force what you consider funny onto someone else. Sometimes you need to just let it go and try again. People didn't find that joke funny but it doesn't mean they won't find your next joke funny. Instead of getting upset about it you should just try again! Post something else, if at first you don't succeed try try again!

> [{quoted}](name=Rivini,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=EPgu0Lz8,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-07-19T04:59:21.744+0000)
>
> It's not even just M&G. There's something about this whole new community that's so off. I don't know what it is, but they don't understand true comedy.
> 
> Sample evidence:
> 
> http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/cyuNM3wq-gangplanks-old-chest-hair-was-one-thing-but
> Observant and witty, yet loathed. 
> Why? 
> Who knows. Regardless of it being in the wrong section, **why is the community so sour about it?**
> 
> Yet something that makes 0 sense will receive tons of praise:
> http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/7gbIVAAT-when-your-ally-begs-you-not-to-killsteal-the-3-hp-enemy-champion
> 
> You can also post a champion's portrait to get likes as well. Nothing but the portrait. We're not allowed to make this new community think too much, apparently (this is also why Malzahar, of all champions, is being Olaf'd.). Even though the thread attempted to tell a joke, "Moon-do" isn't even funny, and it's a bit of a stretch even for a pun.
> http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/Bmv20Qbd-who-is-dianas-number-1-supporter 
> 
> It can't be because I'm surely older than 90% of the people who live on this forum. If something isn't clever or doesn't make sense, it isn't funny. I want to say this generation has rotted their brains out from Spongebob and staring at their phones all day, but that seems too extreme to be true.

In those 3 examples you listed, only the Arceus one was truly humorous.
 The first one, your post about Jhin, it wasn't readily apparent what exactly you were talking about, and you had to explain what the joke was. That's not humor, because most people playing Jhin have seen his rope sash belt and wouldn't have made the connection you were trying to make.
The second link was actually amusing, because ithe conveyed the disregard that the player has when someone is begging them to not kill an enemy they've clearly worked to near death.
The third one is equally as bad as the first because whoever posted it had to explain it. Mundo can be pronounced with slight nuances that most players wouldn't right off the bat get a moon reference, so again, it was a bad joke. 

It's indicative of an inability to write witty jokes when the joke isn't outwardly apparent or at least apparent after a brief look. If it's still an unknown because of a very limited frame of reference, it's safe to say the joke fell flat.

Cuz people are #Triggered

/s or is it not?
Oh, why u has a sad :(
Because sometimes the pun is just THAT bad.

{{champion:26}} Some cats just want to watch the world bur-
{{champion:107}} Shutup Alfred.
